intro: Hieracium luescheri, commonly known as Lüchser's hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is native to Europe and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils. It has lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture and produces numerous small, seed-like fruits. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some regions.
